name: CλaSH
body:
# Installation
1. Download GHC-HEAD for your platform (See [GHC-HEAD (type-nats branch)](#ghc-head-type-nats-branch))
2. Unpack (`tar xjf`) the tarball and `cd` to the directory 
3. Run `./configure --prefix=<INSTALLDIR>`
4. Add the `bin` directory to your path: `PATH=<INSTALLDIR>/bin:$PATH`
5. Download the CλaSH binary for your platform (See [CλaSH Binaries](#c%CE%BBash-binaries)) to `$INSTALLDIR/bin` and rename it to `clash`
6. Download the CλaSH primitives (See [CλaSH Primitive Definitions](#c%CE%BBash-primitive-definitions))
7. Unpack (`tar xzf`) the primitives tarball to `<PRIMDIR>`
8. Add a new environment variable (`CLASH_PRIMDIR`) pointing to the `<PRIMDIR>` directory: `export CLASH_PRIMDIR="<PRIMDIR>"`
9. Verify everything is working by:
   * Downloading the FIR.hs example
   * Running `clash --interactive FIR.hs`
   * Executing the `:vhdl` command, leave the interpreter using `:q`
   * Examine the VHDL code in the `vhdl` directory
